content: How can I help you today?

Honestly, I've been struggling to sleep lately. I'm really stressed about work, and I can't stop worrying about getting fired. It's been hard to shut my mind off at night, and I guess that's what's keeping me up.

That sounds really challenging—trying to manage stress and worries about work while also not being able to get the rest you need can take a toll. It's understandable that those thoughts would make it harder to sleep. How has this stress been affecting your days?

I've been feeling so drained during the day, which makes it hard to focus at work and be present with my family. It's like this cycle—I'm tired because I can't sleep, but then I worry even more because I feel like I'm not performing well. It’s honestly exhausting.

It sounds like this cycle of sleepless nights, feeling drained, and worrying about your performance has been overwhelming for you. Being exhausted and unable to focus must make everything feel even harder. What have you been doing to try to manage this stress so far?

Honestly, I haven't been doing much. I just kind of lay in bed hoping I'll fall asleep, but then my mind starts racing again. Sometimes I try watching TV or scrolling on my phone, but that doesn't really help either. It's like I don't know what else to do.

It makes sense that you've tried things like TV or your phone to distract yourself, hoping it'll quiet your racing thoughts. But it sounds like those methods haven’t been giving you much relief. What do you think might help you feel calmer or more in control of your thoughts at night?
I'm not really sure. I mean, maybe finding a way to just shut my brain off or distract myself in a better way? But I feel so stuck right now, I don't even know where to start.

Feeling stuck can make it harder to figure out the next step, especially when you're juggling stress and exhaustion. It's okay not to have all the answers. What would be the smallest change you think could make your evenings feel a bit easier or less overwhelming?

Maybe having some sort of routine before bed could help, something to try to unwind a bit earlier. I don’t know—it’s hard to think about where to start, but I guess even one small thing might make a difference.

Considering a routine to help you unwind sounds like a thoughtful idea. Even a small step could be a positive start toward calming your mind before bed. Is there anything you already enjoy or find relaxing that could be part of this routine?
Maybe reading a book or taking a warm shower could help me wind down. I used to enjoy reading, but it’s been a while since I made time for it. It might be something worth trying again.

Those sound like great ideas—reading and taking a warm shower can both be calming and help signal to your mind that it's time to relax. Reconnecting with something you used to enjoy, like reading, might also bring some comfort. How do you feel about giving one of these a try tonight?
I think I could try that tonight. Maybe I’ll start with a warm shower and then read for a bit to see if it helps calm my mind. It’s worth a shot.

That sounds like a wonderful way to start—a warm shower followed by reading could give you a peaceful transition to bedtime. It’s great to see you considering this small change. Is there anything else on your mind about sleep or stress that you’d like to explore?
I think that's it for now. I'll give this bedtime routine a try and see how it goes. Thanks for listening.

You're very welcome, and it's great that you're willing to try something new tonight. Taking this step is a positive move towards feeling more at ease. If things remain challenging, don't hesitate to reach out for extra support, whether here or with a professional. You’ve got this!
